oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Mary Carter Paints Grand Ole Opry - 1965-11-27
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: The recording is of a variety of live shows from the Grand Ole Opry. The recordings feature artist performances by: Marty Robbins (musician), Stringbean (musician), the Crook Brothers (musical group), Bill Anderson (musician), Sonny James (musician), Wilma Lee and Stoney Cooper (musical duo), Lonzo and Oscar (musical duo), Curly Fox (musician), Roy Acuff (musician), and Roy Drusky (musician). The first show is from November 27, 1965. The remaining recordings are from a group of unidentified dates. The tape is labeled the first of thirteen.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Marty Robbins; Stringbean; Crook Brothers; Bill Anderson; Sonny James; Wilma Lee and Stoney Cooper; Lonzo and Oscar; Curly Fox; Roy Acuff; Roy Drusky
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (00:00) An unidentified host introduces the Grand Ole Opry -- (00:18) Mary Carter Paints Jingle (Marty Robbins) -- (01:01) An unidentified host introduces the Grand Ole Opry Show -- (01:21) Big Ball in Town (Stringbean) -- (03:04) Uncle Joe (Crook Brothers) -- (05:07) Bright Lights and Country Music (Bill Anderson) -- (07:41) Martha White Jingle ([Unidentified]) -- (08:03) Grant Turner introduces the Martha White Grand Ole Opry -- (08:36) True Love's a Blessing (Sonny James) -- (10:31) Lafayette (Crook Brothers) -- (12:27) Martha White Theme ([Unidentified]) -- (12:49) Grant Turner introduces the Martha White Grand Ole Opry -- (13:15) Stephen's Work Clothes Theme [featuring Grant Turner voiceover] (Wilma Lee and Stoney Cooper) -- (13:55) Cheated (Wilma Lee and Stoney Cooper) -- (16:35) Country Music Time [fades in and out] (Lonzo and Oscar) -- (18:47) Unidentified tune (Lonzo and Oscar) -- (19:32) Mockingbird (Curly Fox) -- (22:22) Stephen's Work Clothes Theme [featuring Grant Turner outro voiceover] (Wilma Lee and Stoney Cooper) -- (23:02) Pet Milk Theme ([Unidentified]) -- (23:41) Tennessee Central (Roy Acuff) -- (26:06) This Train (Wilma Lee and Stoney Cooper) -- (28:11) Picking on the Old Banjo (Stringbean) -- (30:28) White Lightning Express (Roy Drusky)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Marty Robbins; Stringbean, 1915-1973; Crook Brothers; Anderson, Bill, 1937-; James, Sonny; Cooper, Stoney, 1918-1977; Cooper, Wilma Lee, 1921-2011; Lonzo and Oscar; Fox, Curly; Fox, Curly, 1910-1995; Drusky, Roy; Acuff, Roy; Acuff, Roy, Jr., 1943-;
